intro: Pilosella reflexa, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are hairy and alternate, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Pilosella reflexa is often found in open habitats and is known for its ability to spread through vegetative reproduction.
